body_html:
@vrv Vijay, Just to add on to the page, since the link mentions about different python versions, and it suggests to check which python and which python-config.
And this is what I got when I do in the active environment:

(tensorflow) noname@noname-desktop:~/Downloads/software$ which python
/home/noname/tensorflow/bin/python
(tensorflow) noname@noname-desktop:~/Downloads/software$ which python-config
/home/noname/tensorflow/bin/python-config
(tensorflow) noname@noname-desktop:~/Downloads/software$ python --version
Python 2.7.11

And then this is the output outside the environment:

noname@noname-desktop:~$ which python
/home/noname/.linuxbrew/bin/python
noname@noname-desktop:~$ which python-config
/home/noname/.linuxbrew/bin/python-config
noname@noname-desktop:~$ python --version
Python 2.7.11

body:
@vrv Vijay, Just to add on to the page, since the link mentions about different python versions, and it suggests to check `which python` and `which python-config`. 
And this is what I got when I do in the active environment: 

```
(tensorflow) noname@noname-desktop:~/Downloads/software$ which python
/home/noname/tensorflow/bin/python
(tensorflow) noname@noname-desktop:~/Downloads/software$ which python-config
/home/noname/tensorflow/bin/python-config
(tensorflow) noname@noname-desktop:~/Downloads/software$ python --version
Python 2.7.11
```

And then this is the output outside the environment:

```
noname@noname-desktop:~$ which python
/home/noname/.linuxbrew/bin/python
noname@noname-desktop:~$ which python-config
/home/noname/.linuxbrew/bin/python-config
noname@noname-desktop:~$ python --version
Python 2.7.11
```
